Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that lacks water, showing it as wilting or dry.
The student can draw a plant that lacks light, showing it as struggling or not growing well.
The student can identify and label the parts of the plant in their drawing, such as leaves, stems, and roots.
The student can illustrate the difference between a plant growing in sunlight and one kept in the dark over time.
The student can depict how light and water affect the growth and health of the plant, showcasing a clear pattern of what plants need to thrive.
